title: Agora 21 Participation Hub
summary: Drafted a civic engagement playbook and prototype that explores how residents might follow policy stories from idea to action. The concept documents accessible patterns, narrative framing, and service handoffs for future pilots.

hero.title: Agora 21 Participation Hub
hero.subtitle: Exploring what an inclusive civic engagement platform could look like if we centered storytelling and accountability.
hero.summary: I collaborated with a city innovation lab to create a reference prototype and service blueprint that illustrate how residents could discover issues, contribute stories, and follow policy proposals‚Äîwork that remains a concept and has not been implemented.

overview.title: Defining the shape of a civic storytelling hub
overview.description: Agora 21 outlines how participatory budgeting, local storytelling, and public service updates could share a single responsive system. The prototype focuses on framing policy topics in plain language before inviting people to respond.
highlights: Blended qualitative research with open civic datasets to map engagement gaps.
Crafted modular UI patterns usable across agency pilots.
Defined a north-star service blueprint that ties in-person forums to digital touchpoints.

media.alt: Dashboard mockups showing the Agora 21 civic hub experience

challenge.title: Residents wanted clarity, not another civic portal
challenge.description: Secondary research and listening sessions with community advocates showed that previous participation tools felt extractive. People were asked for feedback with little visibility into outcomes, while organizers struggled to help less tech-savvy neighbors participate.
list: Opaque policy language made residents question if their input would matter.
Accessibility gaps‚Äîparticularly screen reader support‚Äîlimited participation.
No shared source of truth connected civic events, proposals, and service updates.

solution.title: A narrative-driven civic workflow
solution.description: We reframed engagement as a continuous story. The concept introduces issues, highlights community voices, and imagines how residents might move toward collective decisions while seeing transparent progress signals from city staff.

media.alt: Storyboard illustrating the Agora 21 participation journey

steps.title: Activate trust with contextual onboarding
steps.description: Progressive onboarding tailors copy by district, reading level, and policy familiarity so everyone starts with the same context.

steps.title: Orchestrate engagement moments
steps.description: Residents can browse live proposals, contribute stories, or join facilitated dialogues. A modular layout adapts to mobile and kiosk deployments.

steps.title: Close the loop with transparent updates
steps.description: A civic timeline shows when ideas move from discussion to funding, giving contributors credit and nudging them toward next steps.

modules.title: Policy explainers with adaptive literacy
modules.description: Micro-lesson cards translate budget jargon into action-focused prompts and include audio narration for accessibility.

modules.title: Story submissions become data
modules.description: Residents can record stories via voice or text; transcripts are tagged for policymakers and shared back with the community.

modules.title: Every action laddered to outcomes
modules.description: Each proposal displays milestones, responsible agencies, and upcoming engagement opportunities in one glance.

impact.title: Proof points from usability and pilot sessions
impact.description: Concept testing with a small group of advocates helped us stress-test the narrative flow and surface what evidence stakeholders would need before piloting it in the wild.
results: Advocates responded positively to the idea of tracing their submissions across milestones but noted outstanding questions about data governance.
City staff requested clearer guidance on how to resource content updates before moving forward.
No funding was committed‚Äîthis remains a reference playbook awaiting a sponsor.

interaction.title: Designing for hybrid civic rituals
interaction.description: Each module was envisioned to extend from neighborhood pop-ups to desktop dashboards, pending future pilots.

cards.title: Participation Compass
cards.description: A responsive navigation widget suggests the next meaningful action based on resident goals and time commitment.

cards.title: Neighborhood Signals
cards.description: Geo-aware alerts highlight nearby events and mutual aid efforts so local wins remain visible.

cards.title: Policy Workspace
cards.description: City staff see aggregated community insights alongside implementation tasks, keeping public input front-and-center.

process.title: Research to blueprint in six sprints
process.description: A tight feedback loop with residents, advocates, and city operations partners helped pressure test the service vision before requesting any engineering investment.

sections.title: 1. Ground the work in community evidence
sections.description: We ran multilingual listening labs and co-analysis sessions with civic groups to prioritize barriers that truly blocked participation.

findings.title: Trust hinges on visible follow-through
findings.description: Residents needed receipts that ideas would not disappear, prompting the timeline pattern.

findings.title: Accessibility is cultural, not just technical
findings.description: Community organizers asked for story prompts and audio captions to help neighbors participate together.

sections.title: 2. Prototype the multi-channel journey
sections.description: We translated the research insights into a service blueprint that connects community events, SMS nudges, and the digital hub.

steps.title: Concept Sketching
steps.description: Sketched flows across kiosk, mobile, and facilitator dashboards.

steps.title: Content Modeling
steps.description: Structured stories, proposals, and status updates as reusable content types.

steps.title: Pilot Scorecard
steps.description: Defined KPIs with city partners to evaluate adoption.

steps.title: Co-Design Sessions
steps.description: Facilitated workshops that aligned civic groups on success criteria.

conclusion.title: What comes next
conclusion.description: Agora 21 currently exists as a playbook for future civic pilots, outlining how measurable trust-building could sit alongside policy rigor once funding and partners are secured.
